column4: All: Guys another box will let me boot HDD, can not login through XWin, but with Alt+F1 logins in fine.  ???  Any ideas?
Originally the chmod on sudoers and sudoers.d was 775, but got that changed to 440 as should be.  supspecting something else in X11 got permissions changed.  What do I look for?
well does X fire at all?
Get the login screen and that is all, fails login every time
But login at tty is good.
Was originally thinking bad/corrupted passwd file but not after getting in on tty.
could you maybe throw your ~/.xsessions-errors into a pastebin?
Looking at it
you didn't paste xsessions-errors?
Just sent you link
K what do you mean?
Oh missed the ~/ part so was looking in wrong place.
well you can always chroot
Updated PB at: http://pastebin.com/tYy0J9jB.  Error is can't open .profile
check the permissions of that file? ls -al ~/ | grep profile ?
Permission are at 775 and owner is root is that the problem?
prolly, depends on the group I guess, but use chown to change the owned
No owner:group is 1000:users, which I think is correct, except I made a change in sudoers, which added this user with sudo, so maybe need to comment that out?
just try sudo chown ndavis:ndavis /home/ndavis/.profile
logged in via liveCD, so can't do that.  Still fighting the inet connect on wlan0, but this waylayed me.
What I was thinking, got a script here somewhere for that.
Hey tried even deleting the .profile, but still can not log in.  Any ideas, no errors without the .profile but also empty desktop.
Actually does log in wo the file, but then no apps etc. since coming from that file.
